settingsPane.description: Misc Tuning
settingsPane.name: Misc Tuning

spinner.description: Enabling Power-efficient Workqueues will help to reduce power consumption at the cost of slight performance overhead. By enabling this, PE workqueues are used for unbound scheduled work to save load on sibling CPU cores and queuing work on CPU 0.
spinner.name: PE WQ

settingsPane.description: You can change max and min frequencies of your device here. 1.190 GHz is the minimum limit of max frequency as below this frequency your device may suffer from high performance degradation. 1.036 GHz is the maximum limit of min frequency as above this frequency your device may not cool down. (Default: Max 2.265 GHz, Min 300 MHz)
settingsPane.name: CPU Frequency control

spinner.description: This is master switch which enables overriding and changing max frequencies on system suspend/resume. If you are using external app to set max-min frequency, keep this driver disabled.
spinner.name: Limiter Driver

spinner.description: This sets maximum frequency of your device. Default 2.265 GHz.
spinner.name: Max CPU Frequency

spinner.description: This sets minimum frequency of your device. Default 300 MHz.
spinner.name: Min CPU Frequency

spinner.description: Use this to overclock CPU above max stock frequency. This feature will be activated only if Max CPU frequency is set to its max value. (2.265 GHz)
spinner.name: Overclock CPU

spinner.description: This sets maximum frequency of your device when screen is off.
spinner.name: Max CPU Suspend Frequency

settingsPane.description: When certain important tasks migrate from a fast CPU to a slow CPU, the frequency of the slow CPU is boosted to be at least as high as the fast CPU for a short duration. You can modify its behavior here. CPU Boost helps alleviating poor user experience. Please note, this boost helps elevating frequencies and doesn't play role in turning CPU cores on/off. To disable CPU Boost, use disabled option for below frequency.
settingsPane.name: CPU Frequency Boost

spinner.description: This sets frequency to which idle CPU is boosted whenever there are incoming input events. Should be lesser or equal to Sync Threshold. Default 1.497 GHz.
spinner.name: Input Event Boost Frequency

spinner.description: During CPU Boost, frequency of slower CPU is matched with that of faster CPU, we can set limit to maximum frequency allowed for frequency synchronization. Should be greater or equal to Input Event Boost Frequency. Default 1.728 GHz.
spinner.name: Sync Threshold

spinner.description: Hotplug Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when CPUs go online.
spinner.name: Hotplug Boost

spinner.description: Wakeup Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when screen is turned on.
spinner.name: Wakeup Boost

spinner.description: Load Based Synchronization enables CPU boost to measure load on the device and boost the frequencies accordingly.
spinner.name: Load Based Sync

seekBar.description: This slider sets boost period for which CPU is boosted when task migrates to slower CPU. Default 10 ms.
seekBar.name: Boost Duration

seekBar.description: This slider sets period for which idle CPU is boosted whenever there are incoming input events. Default 40 ms.
seekBar.name: Input Event Boost Duration

settingsPane.description: You can change governor of your device here. Governor decides current frequency of your device accordingly. Governors marked as TEST are for evaluating purposes, do not use if you are not sure.
settingsPane.name: Governor control

spinner.description: This will set the active CPU governor.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: You can change CPU IO scheduler of your device here.
settingsPane.name: CPU IO Scheduler control

spinner.description: This will set the default IO scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard.
spinner.name: Default IO Scheduler

settingsPane.description: You can select hotplugging method here. Controls given below are specific to MSM Hotplug and Intelli Hotplug only.
settingsPane.name: HotPlug Driver

spinner.description: Switch between different hotplug drivers.
spinner.name: HotPlug Driver

spinner.description: This will decided no. of cores to be boosted when screen is touched. Higher the number of cores, higher the performance. This must be lesser than or equal to no. of Max CPUs online. When is is set to lesser or equal value of Min CPUs online, it is as good as disabled. Default 2.
spinner.name: Touch Boosted CPUs

spinner.description: This will decide minimum number of cores that stays online when device is not suspended. Higher the number of cores, better the performance. This must be less than or equal to no. of Max CPUs online. Default 1.
spinner.name: Min CPUs online

spinner.description: This will decide maximum number of cores that can go online at any given time. Higher the number of cores, better the performance. This must be greater than or equal to no. of Min CPUs online and Boosted CPUs. Default 4.
spinner.name: Max CPUs online

spinner.description: This will decide maximum number of cores that can go online when device is suspended. Higher the number of cores, better the performance. This should be less than or equal to no. of Max CPUs online. Recommended value is greater than 1 to prevent background apps like Music player starving for CPU power and creating glitch. Min CPUs online will change to 1 itself when device is suspended after suspend defer time and restore back to normal value when device is resumed. Default 2.
spinner.name: Max CPUs online (Suspend)

seekBar.description: When device is suspended, sibling cores go offline to save power. However, we don't need them to go offline as soon as the screen is off. Defer suspension by some delay. Default 10 seconds.
seekBar.name: Suspend Defer Time

spinner.description: Full mode profile is specific to Intelli Hotplug with Max CPUs Online = 4. This changes behavior of Intelli Hotplug to perform accordingly.
spinner.name: Full Mode Profile

settingsPane.description: Voltage Range is 730~1225 mV. USE this interface AT YOUR OWN RISK! If you get SOD before you can load this interface and cannot fix your error, reset your profiles by flashing Chaos 12.0, reboot, reflash latest chaos kernel. And think harder before you SOD your CPU with too much UV or OV! CAUTION: VOLTAGE STRUCTURE DIFFERS FOR SOME DEVICES, CLICK CHECK VOLTAGE BELOW AND CHECK WHETHER VOLTAGES LISTED ARE SAME DEFAULT VOLTAGES MENTIONED BELOW... IF THEY ARE NOT SAME, DO NOT USE NXTWEAKS TO CHANGE VOLTAGE... KEEP THIS DISABLED!!
settingsPane.name: CPU Voltage Controls

button.description: Use this button to see what CPU Voltage is used right now!
button.name: Check Active CPU Voltage
button.label: Check CPU Voltage

spinner.description: CPU Voltage Selector for toggling among system-chosen Voltages and Custom Voltages customizable below. If you edited voltages via 'Custom' and wish to disable, then select 'Disabled' option, apply and reboot device. READ CAUTION ABOVE BEFORE ENABLING THIS OPTION.
spinner.name: CPU Voltage Selector

seekBar.description: Negative Offset voltage will act on all levels and decrease voltage accordingly.
seekBar.name: Negative Offset Voltage

seekBar.description: Positive Offset voltage will act on all levels and increase voltage accordingly.
seekBar.name: Positive Offset Voltage

settingsPane.description: You can change GPU settings here and customize as per your use.
settingsPane.name: GPU Control

spinner.description: This will set maximum frequency GPU can attend. Default 450 MHz.
spinner.name: Max GPU frequency

spinner.description: This will set minimum frequency GPU can attend. Default 200 MHz.
spinner.name: Min GPU frequency

seekBar.description: This adjusts the number of times the governor polls for load. Lower == better performance (more battery drain) Default 10.
seekBar.name: Polling Interval

spinner.description: This will set the active GPU governor.
spinner.name: Default GPU Governor

settingsPane.description: OOM(Out of memory) is undesired state where no additional memory resources can be allocated. You can tune behavior of OOM Killer below.
settingsPane.name: OOM Killer

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using below profiles, disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via APP or Script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: AUTO OOM CONTROL

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

settingsPane.description: Settings for Dirty ratio and Dirty background ratio.
settingsPane.name: VM

seekBar.description: The highest % of your memory that can be used to hold dirty data. If you set this to a low value, the kernel will flush small writes to the disk more often. Higher values allow the small writes to stack up in memory. They’ll go to the disk in bigger chunks. (Default: 40%)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

seekBar.description: The lowest % of your memory where pdflush is told to stop when it is writing dirty data. You’ll want to keep this set as low as possible. (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

settingsPane.description: zRAM increases performance by avoiding paging on disk and instead uses a compressed block device in RAM in which paging takes place until it is necessary to use the swap space. zRAM is usually not needed on large RAM device like Nexus 5.
settingsPane.name: zRAM

spinner.description: zRAM Module settings. Here, you can enable/disable ZRAM or add more compressed RAM for your system.
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

spinner.description: If you have enabled swap, higher number = the more the system will swap. Keeping swappiness '0' means swapping occurs only when your device runs out of memory, increasing swappiness will result more battery consumption. Please note SWAP is effective only if zRAM is ON.(Default: 0)
spinner.name: swappiness

spinner.description: Switch between different ZRam compression algorithm.LZO is default. LZ4 may be little faster but is currently under test. YOU MUST TURN OFF ZRAM BEFORE CHANGING COMPRESSION ALGORITHM. (Default: LZO)
spinner.name: Compression Algorithm

button.description: ZRam State check. This is primarily for testing purpose but you can use and check current stats of ZRam, if enabled!
button.name: ZRAM STATS
button.label: ZRam Stats

settingsPane.description: Kernel Samepage Merging
settingsPane.name: KSM

spinner.description: Enable/Disable 'KSM Control'. This will merge some memory but consumes more CPU and battery. This is needed on Nexus 5 only if you are using many memory intensive apps together.
spinner.name: KSM Control

spinner.description: KSM thread to scan pages is getting schedule on definite timeout. That wakes up CPU from idle state and hence may affect the power consumption. Enable deferred timer which suites low-power use-cases.
spinner.name: KSM Deferred Timer

button.description: KSM state check. Memory samepage merging is not quick process. So, stats may show 0 MB initially.
button.name: KSM STATS
button.label: KSM Stats

settingsPane.description: These controls provides settings for triggers to disable DT2W/S2S in order to save more power.
settingsPane.name: Disabling Triggers

spinner.description: If enabled, turning the screen off with the power button disables s2w and dt2w to save battery. When you turn the screen back on, s2w and dt2w return to their previous settings. If the screen times out, s2w/dt2w are not disabled this is only if you use the power button to turn it off.
spinner.name: Power Key Toggle

seekBar.description: This slider sets wake timeout period, which means S2W/DT2W will be disabled if timeout is exceeded after screen off. To disable, set it to 0. Default 0.
seekBar.name: Wake Timeout

settingsPane.description: KnockKnock/Sweep2Wake/Sweep2Sleep Function
settingsPane.name: DT2W, S2W and S2S

spinner.description: This option enables the doubletap2wake (AKA KnockKnock) feature (may cause more battery drain when in pocket)
spinner.name: DT2W

spinner.description: This option enables the sweep2wake feature. When screen is off, you can turn on by swiping LEFT to RIGHT and when screen on.(may cause more battery drain when in pocket)
spinner.name: S2W

spinner.description: This option enables the sweep2sleep feature. When screen on, swipe on the Navigation Bar from LEFT to RIGHT to turn off the screen.
spinner.name: S2S

seekBar.description: This slider helps increasing/decreasing haptic feedback (vibration) strength for wake controls. Default 20.
seekBar.name: Haptic Feedback

settingsPane.description: It is not recommended to apply changes while playing music. Also please note, more the gain, more is the power consumption.
settingsPane.name: CAF Sound

spinner.description: This is main control for CAF Sound customization. You can set a preset profile or custom profile or completely disable sound control via NXTweaks. Sliders below are effective only if this control is set to 'Custom'
spinner.name: CAF Sound Control

seekBar.description: Analog Output Attenuation. Default 36. Note: Attenuation is decrease in sound level.
seekBar.name: Custom Headphone PowerAmp Attenuation

settingsPane.description: Set temperature limits at which device starts throttling. Increasing these limits will increase performance of device at the cost of over heating.
settingsPane.name: Temperature Control

seekBar.description: This slider sets device temperature limit at which throttling will start. Stock 60. Recommended 70.
seekBar.name: Frequency Throttle Temperature

seekBar.description: This slider sets core temperature limit at which throttling will start. Stock 80. Recommended 110. Cores should not be throttled, frequency should be throttled to control temperature.
seekBar.name: Core Throttle Temperature

settingsPane.description: Set hysteresis value for temperature limits. When throttling temperature is reached, device will start throttling until temperature is reduced by hysteresis value. Do not change these values unless you are completely sure.
settingsPane.name: Hysteresis Control

seekBar.description: This slider sets hysteresis value for frequency throttle temperature. Stock 10. Recommended 5.
seekBar.name: Frequency Throttle Temperature Hysteresis

seekBar.description: This slider sets hysteresis value for core throttle temperature. Stock 10. Recommended 5.
seekBar.name: Core Throttle Temperature Hysteresis

seekBar.description: This slider sets number of frequency steps to be considered while throttling. Stock 2. Recommended 2.
seekBar.name: Frequency Stepping

settingsPane.description: This section controls kernel tweaks of the device.
settingsPane.name: Kernel Tweaks

spinner.description: This loads well known color profiles to achieve gamma correction better than stock. Not recommended to use with below color preset. This option is for users who don't wish to calibrate gamma using calibration app. We will add new profiles based on suggestions and tested results. After loading the color profile turn screen off and then on to see effect.
spinner.name: Color Profiles

spinner.description: There are two color presets: stock and slightly cooler. When this option is enabled you will have slighly cooler and vivid color preset. For changes to take effect use power button to lock screen off and then on.
spinner.name: Color Tweak

spinner.description: Here you can select TCP congestion control method of your choice. CUBIC is stock default. HTCP is chaos kernel default and recommended one. If you are unaware about congestion control, do not change this setting.
spinner.name: Net Congestion Control

spinner.description: This controls app logger module (logcat), if set to auto mode - logger will turn off when screen is turned off to contribute some power saving. Keep it disabled if you don't check logcat anytime.
spinner.name: Logger Control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable additional kernel debug logs (requires reboot)
checkbox.name: Additional Debug Logs
checkbox.label: Enable additional debug logs

seekBar.description: This slider helps increasing/decreasing vibrator strength. Default 75.
seekBar.name: Vibrator Strength

spinner.description: Sleeper Fairness is a concept used by CFS (Default task scheduler) which treat sleeping/waiting tasks as if they were in a run queue. This implies tasks which spend most of the time waiting for an user input and such will get a fair share of CPU when they need it. Disabling Gentle Fair Sleeper could improve UI responsiveness. Effect on battery consumption is not tested.
spinner.name: Gentle Fair Sleeper

spinner.description: Enable/Disable Dynamic File Sync. While screen is on, file sync is temporarily deferred, when screen is off, a flush is called to synchronize all outstanding writes. Please note: There may be loss of slight data if device reboots abruptly when Dynamic Fsync is enabled.
spinner.name: Dynamic FSync

spinner.description: This option allows some cheap USB chargers with power supply greater than 500 mA to be recognized as an AC charger in order to charge at a faster rate.
spinner.name: Fast Charge

spinner.description: Backlight dimmer allows you to adjust the LCD screen brightness lower than is possible with stock. Be careful, you can lower the brightness so much you can barely see it.
spinner.name: Backlight Dimmer

seekBar.description: Threshold value for backlight dimmer. Default 15.
seekBar.name: Backlight Dimmer Threshold

seekBar.description: Offset value for backlight dimmer. Default 0.
seekBar.name: Backlight Dimmer Offset

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate some cron jobs, which will automatically run in the background, at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: Cron Jobs

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect! AFTER CHANGING ANY CRON JOB SETTINGS, YOU MUST TURN OFF AND THEN TURN ON CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH FOR CRON JOBS TO WORK AS REQUIRED.
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if this Cron Task service is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON, and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting Cron. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: Cron Reset
button.label: Reset Cron

checkbox.description: Cron to clear file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every Hour

checkbox.description: Cron to update AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. The script will check, if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script will turn wifi, wait for connection and update, then when it is finished it will turn WIFI off. If there is no connection, an error will be written in the log.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to zipalign app is every day at 4:50AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, applications FC, and improve applications load speed. WARNING! Bakcup all apps before use! This process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
checkbox.name: Zipalign Task
checkbox.label: Zipalign Task Every day at 4:50 AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Zipalign and Optimize your apps
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start Zipaligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive, it is OK, do not use phone for 2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all user applications before use! This process will remove applications that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK, and update the broken applications!.
button.name: Zipalign Apps
button.label: Zipalign Now

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2min.
button.name: Database Optimization
button.label: Optimize DB Now

settingsPane.description: Cached RAM is RAM occupied by the applications and background process for faster loading of same.
settingsPane.name: Cached RAM

button.description: This will release all cached and buffered RAM
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: Clean RAM Buffer

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can find GPS and NTP settings and options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS-Time-Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS Zone Check

button.description: Update time via NTP server
button.name: UPDATE TIME
button.label: Update Time

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add, Update or Remove AD Blocker! You need ROOT to do the tweak! If you want to update the blocker, you can push the UPDATE AD NOW button, to get the new one installed! If you install a new ROM, and you want to use AD BLOCKER, then push UPDATE AD NOW and REBOOT. If you need to REMOVE AD-BLOCKER use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is used right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can switch between profile of your choice. Balanced profile is default profile. TO LOAD/RESTORE PROFILE, SELECT YOUR CHOICE AND WAIT ~30 SEC FOR APP TO LOAD AND RESTART WITH NEW SETTINGS.
settingsPane.name: NXTweaks Profiles

button.description: This will load and apply power saving settings for NXTweaks. Kernel will be biased for more power saving with comparatively less performance. This profile is not recommended for gamers.
button.name: Power-Save NXTweaks Settings
button.label: Battery Profile

button.description: This will load and apply balanced settings for NXTweaks. You will experience very good performance with efficient battery usage. This is ideal profile for most users.
button.name: Balanced NXTweaks Settings
button.label: Balanced Profile

button.description: This will load and apply performance settings for NXTweaks. You will get best performance kernel can give at the cost of little more power consumption.This is best profile for gamers and heavy application users.
button.name: Performance NXTweaks Settings
button.label: Performance Profile

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new version. When you restore your settings, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings.
settingsPane.name: NXTweaks Profile Settings Backup and Restore

button.description: Backup NXTweaks User Settings!
button.name: Backup Current Profile
button.label: Backup Now

button.description: Restore NXTweaks User Settings!
button.name: Restore Current Profile
button.label: Restore Now

settingsPane.description: These are the most useful debug logs. Post THEM along with description of issue faced with ROM name.
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for different kernel parameters like LMK, Schedulers, etc. This can be useful to report freezes.
button.name: Kernel-Config-Debug
button.label: Kernel-Config-Debug

button.description: Bug-Report for apps using logcat
button.name: App-Debug
button.label: Apps-Debug

button.description: Bug-Report after kernel crash. Use this to report SODs (sleep of deaths) or random restarts or if you had to press the power key for 7 seconds to reset after freeze. Upload log to forum. We may try to get it resolved.
button.name: LAST-KERNEL-LOG
button.label: Last-Kernel-Log
